stem: An 81-year-old client with heart failure is admitted after accidentally doubling his Digoxin dose for a week. Based on the documentation in the Emergency Cardiac Rhythm & PACER Log tab, complete the bowtie by selecting the most likely condition, the two actions the nurse should take, and the two parameters the nurse should monitor.

tabs.title: SBAR
tabs.content:
Situation: Acute cardiovascular failure with extreme bradycardia.
Background: Chronic heart failure. Confused with medication dosages.
Assessment: Heart rate is 32 bpm. Client is unresponsive to loud voices and pale.
Recommendation: Immediate Digibind and possible pacing.

tabs.title: Cardiac Rhythm & PACER Log
tabs.content:
Assessment ItemCurrent FindingInterpretation
EKG Rhythm3rd Degree Heart BlockElectrical dissociation
Digoxin Level4.8 ng/mLSevere Toxicity
Serum Potassium (K+)6.1 mEq/LHigh (Common in acute Dig tox)
Cardiac OutputCritically LowShock State

actionOptions.text: Prepare for Transcutaneous Pacing (TCP) until Digibind takes effect
Administer Digoxin Immune Fab (Digibind) IV as prescribed
Administer IV Atropine 0.5mg repeatedly until HR is 80
Apply cooling blankets to reduce the heart's metabolic load

parameterOptions.text: Heart rate and EKG rhythm (Monitor for capture and rate)
Blood pressure and mental status (Assessment of perfusion)
Daily measurement of fasting serum glucose
Presence of a positive Babinski sign

rationale.correct: This is Digoxin-Induced 3rd Degree Heart Block (c2). Digoxin slows conduction through the AV node; when toxic (4.8), it can completely block the node, leading to dissociative rhythms. Priority #1 is the antidote, Digibind (a2), which binds the drug. However, until the antidote works, the patient is in shock (BP 74/38). Transcutaneous Pacing (a1) is the immediate bridge to keep the patient alive. Monitoring focuses on the electrical rate (p1) and hydraulic perfusion (p2).
clinicalPearls: In Digoxin-induced heart block, Atropine is often INEFFECTIVE because the block is at the node/bundle level.
Digoxin toxicity is often associated with Hyperkalemia; correcting the K+ helps the EKG but the Digibind is the definitive fix.
Digibind dosing is calculated based on the number of pills ingested or the serum level.

questionTrap.trap: Relying on Atropine for a heart block of 32 in a Dig-toxic patient.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: If Atropine doesn't work after the first dose, go straight to Pacing. Don't waste time while the BP is 74/38.
